ui <- page_fillable(
  
  card(
    card_header("Select Studies"),
    selectInput(
      "condition",
      label = NULL,
      choices = list("Experimental" = TRUE, "Control" = FALSE),
      selected = TRUE
    ),
    checkboxGroupInput(
      "labOnline",
      label = NULL,
      choices = list("Lab" = TRUE, "Online" = FALSE),
      selected = c(TRUE, FALSE)
    )
  ),
  card(dataTableOutput("selectedStudies"))
  
)

# Define your Shiny server logic here
server <- function(input, output, session) {

  output$selectedStudies <- renderDataTable({
    
    # Select studies / conditions
    st <- subset(st, st$Experimental == input$condition)
    
    # Check if no checkboxes are selected
    if (length(input$labOnline) == 0) {
      # If none are selected, return an empty data frame
      return(data.frame())
    } else {
      # Filter the data based on the selected checkboxes
      st <- subset(st, st$Labstudy %in% input$labOnline)
    }
    
    st
    
  })

}


# Create and launch the Shiny app
shinyApp(ui, server)

<!-- In this analysis all Micro-Pk studies of the Maier Lab are included that hypothesize the **presence** of an effect. In studies comparing experimental to control conditions, only the experimental conditions are included. The effect size for "Smokers 1" is inverted, since a two-tailed hypothesis was formulated and the resulting effect was negative. All other studies/conditions have directional hypotheses. -->
